etymology.description: 网(網) (wǎng, phonetic) + 山(山) (shān, "mountain") = ridge
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the phonetic component 网(網) to suggest pronunciation and the semantic component 山(山) to indicate its meaning related to mountains, forming the concept of a 'ridge'.

examples.chinese: 远处的山冈全被绿色覆盖(遠處的山岡全被綠色覆蓋)。
examples.pinyin: Yuǎn chù de shān gāng quán bèi lǜ sè fù gài.
examples.english: The distant ridge is completely covered in green.

examples.chinese: 登上山冈(登上山岡)，你会看到美丽的风光(你會看到美麗的風光)。
examples.pinyin: Dēng shàng shān gāng, nǐ huì kàn dào měi lì de fēng guāng.
examples.english: Climb the ridge, and you will see beautiful scenery.

examples.chinese: 清晨时分(清晨時分)，雾气缭绕在连绵的山冈上(霧氣繚繞在連綿的山岡上)。
examples.pinyin: Qīng chén shí fēn, wù qì liáo rào zài lián mián de shān gāng shàng.
examples.english: In the early morning, mist hovers over the rolling ridges.
